intro: Euphrasia chodatii, commonly known as Chodat's eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in alpine environments. Its leaves are opposite and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in whorls along the stems. Euphrasia chodatii is often found in high-altitude meadows and is adapted to cold, harsh climates.
